title: Creating a server ping indicator on the interface?
body:
Would Riot create a server ping indicator on the interface?

This way you know what your ping will be before entering the game?

Also, for the OCE server, who does Riot use for their upstream providers for the server?  Anyone know?

Cheerio.

replies.body: To further seras' reply, I made a nice little batch file to view your ping which can be found [here](https://boards.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/player-creations/Qgqm11ad-i-made-an-open-source-ping-testing-tool-for-oce-other-regions)

If you just want to check your general ping then press start > type "cmd" > open the command prompt > type "ping google.com" and it'll give you some nice numbers to look at. 

If you want to check your ping to Riot specifically then you can run a tracert to the server (start > type "cmd" > command prompt > tracert 103.240.227.5) though the actual server won't respond to ping, the final hop is a Riot peer and will essentially mirror your in game ping. Failing that, just create a custom game and check the ping that way.
